title: Day 3 Practical
text:
Question 3
Plot the function \(f(x) = \sin(x)\) for \(x \in [-2, 2]\).

x = runif(1000,-2,2)

x = seq(-2,2,length = 10000)

y = sin(x)

plot(y~x,type = "l")

title: Prac 1
text:
Question 1

#Reading in dataset into object 
df = airquality

#Find all rows where there are missing values 
findNa = function(df) {
  
  ln = nrow(df)
  
  vec = c()

  
    for (x in 1:ln) {
      if (anyNA(df[x,])) {
      vec = c(vec,x)}
    }
  
  return(vec)
  
}



Question 2

#Mean,sd,min,max of temprature 

df = airquality

mean(df$Temp)

[1] 77.88235

sd(df$Temp)

[1] 9.46527

min(df$Temp)

[1] 56

max(df$Temp)

[1] 97

#Mean,sd,min,max of ozone level 
mean(df$Ozone,na.rm = TRUE)

[1] 42.12931

sd(df$Ozone,na.rm = TRUE)

[1] 32.98788

min(df$Ozone,na.rm = TRUE)

[1] 1

max(df$Ozone,na.rm = TRUE)

[1] 168




Question 3

#Linear Regression 
data = cars


#Assigning x and y values
x = data$speed 
y = data$dist


#Making x a design vector 
x = cbind(1, x)

#Computing beta hat 
beta = solve(t(x)%*%x)%*%t(x)%*%y
print(beta)

        [,1]
  -17.579095
x   3.932409



lm(data$dist~data$speed)


Call:
lm(formula = data$dist ~ data$speed)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)   data$speed  
    -17.579        3.932  


Validated that both betas are the same as finding them using the lm function.
